description: The Michaelmas Daisy (Aster 'Celeste' ) is a truly amazing flower. It blooms in early fall - late September and early October - when many other flowers are fading away. It produces a mass of soft lavender-blue daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and a thick layer of silvery-green leaves. Its unique color combination is lovely and stands out in mixed flower beds. The flowers attract lots of beneficial pollinators, including bees and butterflies. And, with its flowers, it radiates cheer even in the colder months. Every garden will benefit from the presence of this delightful aster!
